questions.question: What problem does 'prop drilling' refer to in React?
options: Passing props to deeply nested components unnecessarily
Using the same prop name in multiple components
Passing state from child to parent
Rendering multiple components in a single return
questions.answer: Passing props to deeply nested components unnecessarily

questions.question: What is the purpose of the useCallback hook?
options: To fetch API data
To memoize a function so it doesn’t get recreated unnecessarily
To store a value in local storage
To cancel a component’s render
questions.answer: To memoize a function so it doesn’t get recreated unnecessarily

questions.question: Which of the following best describes controlled components in React?
options: Components that are controlled by Redux
Components that are directly manipulated with refs
Components where form data is handled by the DOM
Components where form data is handled by React state
questions.answer: Components where form data is handled by React state

questions.question: What does the useEffect hook's dependency array do?
options: Forces the effect to run every render
Determines when the effect should re-run
Optimizes rendering performance
Tells React to ignore the effect
questions.answer: Determines when the effect should re-run

questions.question: What is the purpose of React.memo?
options: To memoize props to a component
To avoid unnecessary re-renders of functional components
To store memoized values in local storage
To convert a class component to a functional one
questions.answer: To avoid unnecessary re-renders of functional components
